page.title: 05Elstree Transforming Station
page.content: The Electricity Transforming Station is located in squares 05140197 and 05140196 and occupies an operational site of 17 acres obtained by compulsory purchase from Hillfield Farm. A further 11 acres are leased out to Patchetts Green Equestrian Centre and might be developed in the future. The station became operational in 1955 as part of a ring of plants built, where space allowed, to transform high voltage electricity produced in the Midlands for domestic use in London. The station was intended to be operational for 25 years but new technology has extended its useful life. It employs 8 qualified members of the Institute of Electrical Engineers who supervise the plant, local lines and pylons, and 18 fitters who maintain the sight. It is one of the areas uglier sights.
